values.title: FarmOverflow
values.events.commandLimit: Limit of 50 attacks reached, waiting return.
values.events.noUnits: No units avaliable in village, waiting attacks return.
values.events.noUnitsNoCommands: No villages has units or commands returning.
values.events.noVillages: No villages avaliable, waiting attacks return.
values.info.development2: Developed from Brazil with ❤ by
values.info.development3: Any email reporting error, suggestion, messages of love or hate will be wellcome.
values.info.groupOnly1: Using only villages from a group to attack
values.info.groupOnly2: You can select a specific group to use only the villages from that group to attack.
values.info.ignore2: You can select ignore targets setting a Ignore Group. All villages that assigned in that group will be ignored by the FarmOverflow. The group works on targets and your own villages as well.
values.info.include2: As well as ignoring villages, you can include village targets of players. Works only in villages inside the maximum distance range.
values.info.presets2: FarmOverflow uses the game's presets that you set up, you just need to select one on the settings tab, save and run to start the farm!
values.info.presets3: As the game only allows send presets that is activated on the village. FarmOverflow will activate it automatically if not already activated.
values.info.presets4: You can user more than one preset, since it have the same name (you can put a small description at the end to help identification)
values.info.presets5: See some name exemples for presets:
values.info.presets6: Attention with officers, they will be used if they are activated on the presets.
values.info.randomBase2: That interval is a random period of time (in seconds) between each attack avoid the FarmOverflow to be detected by the game. The bigger the better.
values.info.ignoreOnLoss2: This option will ignore any target that cause loss in your troops.
values.info.ignoreOnLoss3: The target that cause any loss to your troops will be ignored in the future.
values.info.ignoreOnLoss4: Note: For this feature works properly, the option "Ignore villages from group" must be set.
values.info.priorityTargets2: When activated, all targets that has full haul reports, will be added to the list of priorities, to resend the attack as soon as possible.
values.info.remote2: let the FarmOverflow working in home and control it by the app of game!
values.info.remote3: Set the subject of message where you will control the FarmOverflow in the "Settings" tab
values.info.remote4: Create a message and add yourself as a recipient. On the subject put what you set, and in the message use one of the fallowing commands:
values.info.remote7: receive the current status of farm
values.info.remote8: If you don't receive the message "OK" in return, means that the FarmOverflow did not receive the message or the command was invalid.
values.info.remote9: Attention: Works only if you are the only participant in the message!
values.info.remote10: You can use the same message to execute other commands, just reply the message.
values.settings.groupOnly: Attack only with villages from group
values.settings.ignoreOnLoss:
Ignore villages that cause loss
(Need a active group of ignoreds)
values.settings.priorityTargets: Prioritize targets with full loot report
values.settings.eventVillageChange: Show task logs of village's changes
values.settings.eventPriorityAdd: Show task logs of priority targets
values.settings.eventIgnoredVillage: Show task logs of ignored villages
